titles: To the right honourable the Lords and Commons in Parliament assembled. The humble petition of divers well-affected magistrates, ministers, citizens, and other inhabitants in the city of London, and parts adjacent.
author: England and Wales. Parliament.
notes: Annotations on Thomason copy: "July 5. 1648."; "made by mr Nie, for ye Independents, in opposition to what ye Common Counsell, and Commanders had offered ye parliament, [illegilbe] (and called ye Cross-Petition)".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: England and Wales. --  Parliament --  Early works to 1800.
